org.miwarre.ap.gui

Class GuiModelessWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiElement
      • net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiPanel
        • org.miwarre.ap.gui.GuiModelessWindow

  • public class GuiModelessWindow
extends net.risingworld.api.gui.GuiPanel
    A class implementing a mode-less window, made of a title bar and a number of textual strings displayed one below the other. The window is placed near the lower left corner.

    The window has no behaviour, i.e. it just displays the texts and does nothing else; in particular, the player cannot interact with it in any way.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GuiModelessWindow(net.risingworld.api.Plugin plugin, net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player, java.lang.String titleText, java.util.List<java.lang.String> texts)
      Creates a mode-less window with given title and sequence of textual strings for the given player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GuiModelessWindow

        public GuiModelessWindow(net.risingworld.api.Plugin plugin,
                         net.risingworld.api.objects.Player player,
                         java.lang.String titleText,
                         java.util.List<java.lang.String> texts)
        Creates a mode-less window with given title and sequence of textual strings for the given player. The window is placed near the lower left corner and its height and width depend on the number and length of textual strings.
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plug-in this window will belong to
        player - the player this windows will appear for
        titleText - the title of the window
        texts - the textual strings

    • Method Detail

      • setTexts

        public void setTexts(java.util.List<java.lang.String> texts)
        Set new texts into the window. Window position, height and width are adjusted to the new number and length of the textual strings.
        Parameters:
        texts -

      • free

        public void free()
        Closes the window and destroys allocated resources. To be used before relinquishing the object. After calling this method, the window cannot be used any longer.
